articles.title: Peaceful Reunification of Korea Favored
articles.content:
Peaceful Reunification of Korea Favored 
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The meeting of the Executive Council of the Asian Buddhist Conference for Peace held in Russia from August 12 to 14 reportedly supported the cause of independent and peaceful reunification of the Korean Buddhists and people.
 A resolution adopted at the meeting noted that the conference calls for forcing the U.S. forces in south Korea to pull back from there and eliminating all factors of threatening this process

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Greatly Instrumental in Developing Youth Movement
Halt to War Game Demanded
articles.content:
Halt to War Game Demanded 
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly issued a statement on August 22 demanding an immediate halt to the "Ulji Focus Lens-04", a large-scale war game against the north.
 The current joint military drill is being staged under a meticulous plan by the United States and the pro-U.S. war hawks allegedly to test the capability of south Korea-U.S. joint operation for confronting a "contingency" on the Korean peninsula and it is unequivocally a challenge to the desire of the Korean nation for independent reunification and a threat to peace on the Korean peninsula, said the statement.    
 If the United States and pro-U.S. war-hungry elements pursue aggression and war to stifle the DPRK, going against the trend of peace and reunification, they will face with an anti-U.S. resistance of the whole Korean nation, it warned.

Congratulations to President of Vanuatu
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Vanuatu 
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Aug. 23 sent a congratulatory message to Kalkot Mataskelekele on the latter's election as president of the Republic of Vanuatu.
 In the message he expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms and wished the president of Vanuatu great success in his work.

Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of Russia, in connection with the crash of airliners in Russia.
  Upon hearing the shocking news that the crash of airliners in Russia claimed huge casualties, I express profound sympathy and sorrow to you and, through you, to the victims and their bereaved families, the message said.    
 The message sincerely hoped that the president and the government of Russia would eradicate the aftermath of such tragic accidents as early as possible.
